thread.title: Kim Jong-un will unleash 'September 11 size attack on Donald Trump' says top expert
thread.title_full: Kim Jong-un will unleash 'September 11 size attack on Donald Trump' says top expert

title: Kim Jong-un will unleash 'September 11 size attack on Donald Trump' says top expert
text:
GETTY 9/11: Kim's nuclear attack will be Trump;s defining moment, says top expert 
The North Korean dictator has repeatedly threatened to fire a nuclear missile at US heartland , causing death and destruction. 
And a Korean expert has revealed Kim is readying his attack for early in Trump's time in administration. 
The Centre for Strategic and International Studies chairman Victor Cha told a House Foreign Affairs Committee a North Korean attack would be Donald Trump's September 11 and it would define his presidential term. 
GETTY READY FOR WAR: Kim 'will fire ICBM at the US' “North Korea is close to targeting all 50 US states and our Asian allies with a nuclear warhead” Victor Cha 
Nearly 3,000 people died after three planes were deliberately flown into the World Trade Centre and Pentagon in 2001 . 
But the death toll would be much higher if a nuclear missile were to be detonated in the US. 
According to Cha, North Korea is expected to launch an intercontinental ballistic missile early in Trump's administration to test the new US President. Real or fake? The North Korea tyrant Kim Jong-un WANTS the West to see Wednesday, 4th January 2017 As innocent people starve in gulags, Kim Jong-un allows tightly controlled press trips to show a version of North Korea most citizens wouldn't even recognise. Happy, prosperous, developed: check out these pictures and see 1 / 28 AFP/Getty Images A man smokes a cigarette in a bar 
And the only reason Kim has not fired a nuke yet is due to the political situation in South Korea. 
He revealed: "Pyongyang carried out two medium-range ballistic missiles tests prior to President Trump's election on October 15 and 20 last year. 
"The only reason they have not followed the election with an action, we believe, is because of the domestic political crisis in South Korea." 
He added: "Once this crisis of leadership in the South is resolved or even before then, ballistic missile and nuclear tests are sure to follow." 
Kim used his new year's address to tell citizens his ICBM was nearly ready , after perfecting its capability to strike continental US. 
US and South Korean radar picked up two nuclear warheads being placed on the Korean border in the North – but these now appear to have been moved. 
Committee chairman Ed Royce said the tubby tyrant is close to targeting "all 50 (US) states and our Asian allies with a nuclear warhead." PREPARING FOR WAR? America and South Korea prepare to defend against the North Tuesday, 24th January 2017 U.S. and South Korean marines participate in the endurance exercise in temperature below minus 20 degrees celsius under a scenario to defend the country from any possible attacks from North Korea. 1 / 17 Getty Images Marines from 3rd Marine Expeditionary force deployed from Okinawa, Japan, participate in the winter military training exercise with South Korean soldiers 
He also suggested the committee should imply sanctions on North Korean workers sending money home to fuel their economy. 
He added: "With hundreds of thousands of North Korean labourers abroad – sending as much as £1.5 billion a year back to the regime in hard currency – we should look at targeting this expatriate labour." 
The US has also approved plans to move a THAAD missile defence system to South Korea, which would shoot any nuke detonated from the North out of the sky. Related articles
